Pre-Game Insights: Norman Powell's run of 10 straight games with 20+ points came to an end this week in a 2-game set against Houston. The Rockets limited him to 13 points and 8 points in a strong all-around defensive performance.
Utah has the 2nd-worst defensive rating. They're allowing the 5th-most points per game and the 5th-highest shooting percentage.
Utah gets torched from beyond the arc, allowing the 4th-most made 3-pointers on the 5th-most attempts and the 5th-highest 3-point percentage.
Powell is taking a career-high 7.8 3-pointers per game, with nearly half of his points coming from 3-pointers.

Kris Dunn entered LA's starting lineup the past couple of games, giving the Clippers another ball handler who can get the rock to Powell. With Dunn on the floor, Powell has seen a 4.9% usage rate boost and an extra 3.4 shots per 36 minutes.
